channel.title: Remote Server Access
channel.description:
Hi, I have a testscape server setup, and I am using no-ip. I can connect to it locally on pc my server is running on, but I cannot remotely connect from any of my other computers. I configured my router, and even removed it and hardwired straight into my cable model, to be sure it wasn't anything with that, but I still cannot successfully connect remotely. When I login remotely, I do see it hit my server, then after a few seconds I get a disconnected message. It looks like this:
Starting testscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 ClientHandler: Accepted from c-24-3-166-108.hsd1.pa.comcast.net:4272 Client type: high memory version UserId: 26340443 wood1master7 has signed onto server. Game saved for player wood1master7 ClientHandler: Client wood1master7 disconnected from testscape.
Any help on what may be causing this would be appreciated. Thanks in advance.

item.title: Remote Server Access
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

How do I run it normally? I didn’t know I had different options in running the server.
I want this to run online for all, but I don’t know what I have to do differently.
Thanks

Read full topic

item.title: Remote Server Access
item.dc:creator: @faze1one faze1one
item.description:
@faze1one wrote:

[quote=“masan05, post:1, topic:353468”]Hi,
I have a testscape server setup, and I am using no-ip. I can connect to it locally on pc my server is running on, but I cannot remotely connect from any of my other computers. I configured my router, and even removed it and hardwired straight into my cable model, to be sure it wasn’t anything with that, but I still cannot successfully connect remotely. When I login remotely, I do see it hit my server, then after a few seconds I get a disconnected message. It looks like this:

Starting testscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594
ClientHandler: Accepted from c-24-3-166-108.hsd1.pa.comcast.net:4272
Client type: high memory version
UserId: 26340443
wood1master7 has signed onto server.
Game saved for player wood1master7
ClientHandler: Client wood1master7 disconnected from testscape.

Any help on what may be causing this would be appreciated.
Thanks in advance.[/quote]

y dont u just run the server normaly… as if it was onlie for all

Read full topic

item.title: Remote Server Access
item.dc:creator: @masan05 masan05
item.description:
@masan05 wrote:

Hi,
I have a testscape server setup, and I am using no-ip. I can connect to it locally on pc my server is running on, but I cannot remotely connect from any of my other computers. I configured my router, and even removed it and hardwired straight into my cable model, to be sure it wasn’t anything with that, but I still cannot successfully connect remotely. When I login remotely, I do see it hit my server, then after a few seconds I get a disconnected message. It looks like this:

Starting testscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594
ClientHandler: Accepted from c-24-3-166-108.hsd1.pa.comcast.net:4272
Client type: high memory version
UserId: 26340443
wood1master7 has signed onto server.

ClientHandler: Client wood1master7 disconnected from testscape.

Any help on what may be causing this would be appreciated.
Thanks in advance.
